department_name: Contra Costa Health - Environmental Health Division

grading_system.description: Color-coded placarding system with green, yellow, red, and white placards

Green.description: No or minimal health violations found at most recent inspection

Yellow.description: Major health violations found but corrected during inspection, reinspection required

Red.description: Imminent health hazard resulting in facility closure

White.description: Permit holders waiting for renewal or reopening after closure

inspection_details.frequency: Inspections can occur at any time, with facilities subject to surprise inspections twice a year
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Follow-up within the week if violations found during inspection; facilities with two yellow placards in a row require food safety course attendance
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Color-coded placards must be displayed prominently; inspection results available online through food facility inspection database and mobile app

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Contra Costa County Fire Protection District
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial cooking hood fire suppression systems required every six months per NFPA 96 by licensed fire protection companies
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every six months for commercial kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CRFC) - implemented July 1, 2007, modeled after FDA Food Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County Environmental Health Division conducts inspections under California Retail Food Code
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Alcoholic Beverage Sales Commercial Activities Ordinance for unincorporated areas; BAAQMD Commercial Cooking Operation Registration required for some facilities

confidence_notes: Official Contra Costa Health website clearly describes color-coded placarding system with specific definitions for each color. California Retail Food Code basis confirmed. Fire safety requirements verified through CCCFPD sources.
verification_notes: Color-coded placarding system is well-documented on official county health department website. Fire suppression system requirements confirmed through county fire district documentation. CRFC implementation verified from multiple sources.
